page.title: 13Weekley Church, Kettering.
page.content: The church of St.Mary the Virgin is in a walled churchyard next to Boughton Park and serves both House and village. It overlooks a village green on which there is a memorial "To keep in mind the Great War and those from this place who gave their lives." Oddly the south porch of the church is Norman, the tower and spire are Decorated yet the nave, arcade and body are Perpendicular. There are monuments to the Tudor Montagus. Of note are those of two Sir Edwards: one is in alabaster with a Latin epitaph; the later one graces a six-poster tomb with his wife. Many visitors come to ring the six bells the heaviest of which is the tenor which weighs 8 cwt. Regular services are conducted by the incumbent who serves Geddington and Weekley.
